task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 258°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to view the full height of the target building, so I will look up to see the upper portion of the structure that's currently out of my 0° pitch field of view.
I rotated to the wrong heading (0°N) instead of keeping focus on the West target building, so I need to rotate my heading back to 258° to re-align with the target structure.
To view the full height of the target building from ground to roof, I need to check the lower section, so I will rotate the camera down to -30° pitch while keeping the heading aligned to 258°W.
I'm currently facing North (0°) instead of the target West building, so I will rotate to absolute heading 258° and set pitch to 0° to re-align with the target structure and get a level baseline view.
To view the upper portion of the target building and capture its full height, I will rotate the camera up to 30° pitch while maintaining the 258°W heading.
I've drifted to facing North (0°) instead of the target West building, so I will rotate to absolute heading 258° and keep pitch at 30°UP to re-align with the target and view its upper section.
To obtain a more complete, unobstructed view of the target building's entire structure from ground to roof, I will move left 5 meters using available move 2.

I've drifted to facing South (174°) instead of the target West building, so I will rotate to absolute heading 258° and set pitch to 0° to re-align with the target and get a level, full view of the structure.
To view the upper portion of the target building and capture its full height from ground to roof, I will rotate the camera up to 30° pitch while maintaining the 258°W heading.
I'm facing North instead of the target West building, so I will rotate to absolute heading 258° and maintain 30°UP pitch to re-align with the target and view its upper section for height estimation.
Having aligned with the target building and observed its structure, I estimate its height to be 24 meters, as it appears to have 8 typical 3-meter tall floors from ground to roof.
